newsitem.title: USA: CSCE says large coffee stock drop due to "errors".
newsitem.headline: CSCE says large coffee stock drop due to "errors".

text.p: The 24,391 bag drawdown reported in Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange (CSCE) warehouses during the week ended October 18 actually occurred during a different time period but was reported in the latest weekly figures due to "past errors in reporting" by one warehouse, CSCE said in a statement released after the close of business.

The exchange did not say whether the removal of the stocks, which at the time represented an 80 percent fall in inventory for delivery against coffee futures, occurred over a period of several weeks or months

"The recent decline in warehouse certified stocks of coffee reported by the exchange was attributable to past errors in reporting stocks by a warehouse. The last reported number released by the exchange is correct," the statement read.
The CSCE did not name the warehouse responsible for the reporting errors, and no one at exchange was available for comment.

On Monday, October 21, the CSCE published its weekly tally of coffee stocks certified for delivery against the "C" futures contract and housed in warehouses in New York, New Orleans, San Francisco and Miami.
Certified stocks, already at their lowest level in a decade, fell by 24,391 bags in the week ended October 18, the exchange reported then, leaving just 5,583 bags available for delivery.
-- Wendy Pollack, New York Commodities Desk +1 212 859 1640
